comments:
Once the "organize favorites" did not work. I could not add and organize my
favorites. The failure occurred when trying to add my first favorite. I tried it
later and there was no problem organizing my favorites. Unfortunately, I don't
know what triggered the problem.


eclipse.buildId=I200406251208

java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.

Do you know what type of launch configuration it was that you were "making" 
favorite? It looks like there was an unsupported value in the launch 
configuration data (we only support Strings as data in launch configs).

The tasks that I wanted to make favorite exist a long time. I created them in
eclipse 2.1 and there was no problem in running them in eclipse 3.0. I entered
my values in the launch configuration dialog. Is there a way not to enter
strings in the dialog?

Additionally. After the ClassCastException I thought, well it's broken. But a
day later or so (with eclipse restart) I tried again and there was no problem in
organizing my favorites. I think I did not change anything in the launch
configuration in between.

From our UI, you can only enter strings (I wondered if it was a different 
launch config type from a 3rd party plug-in, that could have bugs). Marking as 
works for me, unless we can find a way to reproduce it.
